notes.text: This CSAF advisory was extracted from unstructured data and may contain inaccuracies. If you notice any errors, please reach out to the designated contact at CISA CSAF: central@cisa.dhs.gov

notes.title: Legal Notice

notes.text: Successful exploitation of this vulnerability could allow remote code execution as root.
notes.title: Risk evaluation

notes.text: Commercial Facilities, Energy, Financial Services, Government Facilities, Healthcare and Public Health, Transportation Systems
notes.title: Critical infrastructure sectors

notes.text: CISA recommends users take defensive measures to minimize the risk of exploitation of this vulnerability. Specifically, users should:
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
CISA reminds organizations to perform proper impact analysis and risk assessment prior to deploying defensive measures.
CISA also provides a section for control systems security recommended practices on the ICS webpage onus-cert.gov. Several recommended practices are available for reading and download, including Improving Industrial Control Systems Cybersecurity with Defense-in-Depth Strategies.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

notes.text:
Additional mitigation guidance and recommended practices are publicly available on the ICS webpage on us-cert.gov in the Technical Information Paper, ICS-TIP-12-146-01B--Targeted Cyber Intrusion Detection and Mitigation Strategies.
Organizations observing any suspected malicious activity should follow their established internal procedures and report their findings to CISA for tracking and correlation against other incidents.
notes.title: Recommended Practices

product.name: G-Code EWPC-22xx: firmware Versions 1.12.0.25 and prior as well as the limited Versions 1.12.13.2 and 1.12.14.5
G-Cam EEC-2xxx: firmware Versions 1.12.0.25 and prior as well as the limited Versions 1.12.13.2 and 1.12.14.5
G-Code EBC-21xx: firmware Versions 1.12.0.25 and prior as well as the limited Versions 1.12.13.2 and 1.12.14.5
G-Code ETHC-22xx: firmware Versions 1.12.0.25 and prior as well as the limited Versions 1.12.13.2 and 1.12.14.5
G-Code EFD-22xx: firmware Versions 1.12.0.25 and prior as well as the limited Versions 1.12.13.2 and 1.12.14.5

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')

notes.text: Using a specially crafted URL command, a remote authenticated user can execute commands as root.CVE-2020-16205 has been assigned to this vulnerability. A CVSS v3 base score of 7.2 has been calculated; the CVSS vector string is (AV:N/AC:L/PR:H/UI:N/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).
notes.title: Vulnerability Summary

remediations.details: Geutebrück recommends users update to firmware Version 1.12.0.27
The link for the download area on the Geutebrück website “latest firmware” is the same as for the advisory “security advisory” (Login required).
